title: VIP: overload public method for dynamic arrays
body:
## Simple Summary
Allow returning the full array when no index argument is given to a `public` decorated `DynArray` state variable

## Motivation
It's kind of annoying to have to iterate over an unknown quantity of items in order to extract all of the elements of a Vyper array when using a `DynArray` state variable that's decorated `public`. Usually involves something like:

```py
for idx in range(MAX_SIZE):
    try:
        item = contract.my_array(idx)
    except ContractLogicError:
        break
```

## Specification

Instead it would be way nicer to allow this to be the case:
```py
items = contract.my_array()  # all items in array
# or
item = contract.my_array(idx)  # item at location `idx` in array
```

This would involve generating two separate public methods for the two different method IDs `my_array()` and `my_array(<index-type>)`

## Backwards Compatibility

Since it's an overloaded method, it should be backwards compatible
